title: Greatest Crooners of the 20th Century
description: How well do you remember the golden voices of Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, and the giants of the crooning era?

questions.question: Which crooner was known by the nickname 'Ol' Blue Eyes'?
questions.explanation: Frank Sinatra earned the nickname Ol' Blue Eyes in the 1940s.

questions.question: Nat King Cole was the first African American to host his own television show. Which year did it premiere?
questions.explanation: The Nat King Cole Show premiered on NBC in November 1956.

questions.question: Which crooner and comedian famously sang 'That's Amore' in the 1953 film 'The Caddy'?
questions.explanation: Dean Martin's 'That's Amore' became one of his most beloved signature songs.

questions.question: Bing Crosby's recording of which holiday song is the best-selling single of all time worldwide?
questions.explanation: White Christmas, written by Irving Berlin and sung by Bing Crosby, has sold over 50 million copies.

questions.question: Which crooner is famous for the 1962 classic 'I Left My Heart in San Francisco'?
questions.explanation: Tony Bennett's signature song became a worldwide hit and an anthem for San Francisco.
